intro: Scleranthus falkii, commonly known as Falk's thorn, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features slender, erect stems with small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, clustered in dense, terminal inflorescences. Scleranthus falkii is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
